metadata.title: Wednesday, 16th February, 2022
metadata.session: FIRST SESSION OF THE THIRTEENTH ASSEMBLY

parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans to delimitate some parliamentary constituencies; and
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented.
(a) when the Government will electrify the Munkulungwe Clinic in Kafulafuta Parliamentary Constituency; and
(b) what has caused the delay in electrifying the Clinic.

questions.minister: Minister of Infrastructure, Housing and Urban Development
parts: (a) why the rehabilitation of the Kafue Hook Bridge in Western Province has stalled;
(b) when the project will resume; and
(c) what measures are being taken to expedite the works, considering that the temporary bridge is in a deplorable condition, thereby endangering the lives of travellers.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to upgrade Buli Basic School in Chama South Parliamentary Constituency to a secondary school;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented;
(c) whether the Government has any plans to deploy additional teachers to all primary schools in the Constituency; and
(d) if so, when the plans will be implemented.

questions.minister: Minister of Water Development and Sanitation
parts: (a) when the water reticulation project  under construction in Mpongwe District will be completed;
(b) what the total cost of the project is;
(c) how much money was paid to the contractor, as of September, 2021; and
(d) what the time frame for the completion of the project is.

questions.minister: Minister of Small and Medium Enterprise Development
parts: (a) what measures the Government is taking to ensure that Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) access affordable financing, considering that commercial bank interest rates are very high; and
(b) what measures the Government is taking to create market linkages and value chains for SMEs.
(a) when the Government will procure the following equipment for Kabwe Central Hospital:
(i) Computed Tomography (CT) Scan; (ii) Renal Dialysis Machines; and (iii) X-ray machines;
(b) whether the Government has any plans to increase funding to the Hospital, following its elevation from general hospital to central hospital; and
(c) if so, when the plans will be implemented.

questions.minister: Minister of Home Affairs and Internal Security
parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans to construct staff houses for police officers in Pemba District;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented;
(c) how many houses are earmarked for construction;
(d) what the estimated cost of the project is; and
(e) what the estimated time frame for the completion of the project is.
(a) when the Government will procure desks for schools in Chienge District; and
(b) what the cause of the delay in procuring the desks is.

questions.minister: Minister of Infrastructure, Housing and Urban Development
parts: (a) whether the Government is aware that Mulobezi Railway Line, which is the only reliable means of transport between Livingstone and Mulobezi Districts, is in a deplorable state;
(b) if so, what measures the Government is taking to restore connectivity between the two districts;
(c) when the Railway Line will be rehabilitated; and
(d) whether the rehabilitation will include reconstructing the Bombwe Bridge.

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Rural Development
parts: (a) when the construction of the Kamuchanga Modern Market in Mufulira District will be completed;
(b) what the progress, in percentage terms, on the construction of the Market was, as of September, 2021; and
(c) what the cause of the delay in completing the project is.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to construct dip tanks in Namwala Parliamentary Constituency;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented;
(c) how many dip tanks will be constructed; and
(d) if there are no such plans, why.

questions.minister: Minister of Infrastructure, Housing and Urban Development
parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans to tar the Katunda-Lukulu road in Western Province;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented;
(c) whether the funding for the project has already been sourced; and
(d) if not, when the funds will be sourced.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to establish new farming blocks, countrywide;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented; and
(c) what the progress on the issuance of title deeds to residents of Ngwezi Farming Block in Magoye Parliamentary Constituency, is.
(a) when construction of communication towers in the Chibale and Lundu Chiefdoms in Chama North Parliamentary Constituency will commence;
(b) what the cost of the project is; and
(c) what the time frame for the completion of the project is.
(a) what the total number of international flights recorded at the following airports in 2020 was:
(i) Kenneth Kaunda International Airport; and (ii) Harry Mwaanga Nkumbula International Airport;
(b) how many tourists visited the country during the same period; and
(c) how the number of flights and tourists at (a) and (b) compare with the numbers in 2019.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to deploy doctors to health facilities in Nalolo District; and
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented.

questions.minister: Minister of Infrastructure, Housing and Urban Development
parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans to tar the Chisekesi - Gwembe - Chipepo road in Southern Province;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented;
(c) what the estimated cost of the project is; and
(d) what the estimated time frame for the completion of the project is. 144. Ms M Phiri (Milanzi) to ask the Minister of Infrastructure, Housing and Urban Development:
(a) why the construction of the Katete - Chadiza road has stalled;
(b) when the project will resume;
(c) who the contractor is;
(d) what the cost of the project is; and
(e) what the estimated time frame for the completion of the project.
(a) when the distribution of tricycle ambulances in Petauke District will commence;
(b) what the cause of the delay in commencing the exercise is; and
(c) which health facilities in the District will benefit from the exercise. QUESTION FOR WRITTEN ANSWER (STANDING ORDER 75) W6. Mr Musonda (Lupososhi) - to ask the Vice President:
(a) how many people died due to electoral violence, countrywide, from May, 2021 to August, 2021;
(b) what the names of the victims are;
(c) which political parties the victims were affiliated to; and
(d) how many people have been arrested in connection with the deaths. __________________________
